bioghist.p: A painter, critic, writer, illustrator and graphic artist, Ben Wolf (1914-1996) was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and lived in both Wellfleet, Massachusetts, and Philadelphia. He studied with Carl Nordstrom, Justin Pardi, and Hans Hofmann, and was a member of the Philadelphia Sketch Club. He was a teacher at the Wellfleet School of Art and during World War II was a combat artist for the Coast Guard. He became Assistant Professor of Art at the Provincetown, Massachusetts College of Art and contributed illustrations to publications including Life magazine, Art Digest, and National Observer.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the personal and professional papers of Ben Wolf. Materials include: correspondence; manuscripts of articles, interviews and talks; drafts and research materials for books on Morton Livingston Schamberg and others; correspondence and notes relating to Wolf's career as an illustrator; monographs, catalogs, and announcements; cartoons; clippings of Wolf's published writings; and photographs. There is also a collection of Sherlockiana which includes letters, programs, drawings, articles and clippings, and photographs.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
